New Metrics outside FRAGSTATS

2019-03-04

new_metrics.Rmd

One of the reason to start landscapemetrics was also to have a collection of metrics that are not included in FRAGSTATS. This vignette will highlight them and provide references for further reading on them.

Landscape complexity metrics

Nowosad J., TF Stepinski. 2018. Information-theoretical approach to measure landscape complexity. https://doi.org/10.1101/383281

The standard set of landscape metrics lacks the bona fide indicator of complexity. Information-theoretical framework can be applied to derive four metrics of landscape complexity: H(x,y) – an overall spatio-thematic complexity metric; H(x) – a thematic complexity of landscape classes; H(y|x) – a configurational complexity of landscape pattern; and I(y;x) – a metric disambiguating landscape pattern types having the same value of an overall complexity.

All of these metrics are implemented in landscapemetrics:

  • lsm_l_joinent: an overall spatio-thematic complexity metric.
  • lsm_l_ent: a diversity (thematic complexity) of landscape classes
  • lsm_l_condent: a complexity of a landscape pattern configuration. It measures a only a geometric intricacy (configurational complexity) of a landscape pattern.
  • lsm_l_mutinf: disambiguates landscape pattern types characterize by the same value of an overall complexity.

Contents

  • Landscape complexity metrics

Developed by Maximillian H.K. Hesselbarth, Marco Sciaini, Jakub Nowosad, Sebastian Hanss.
